data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Location ideal. Welcome informative. Whole experience very impersonal. Breakfast unexciting. We went on to stay in quite a number of B&Bs in both the US and Canada, so we quickly came to realise what might normally be expected service-wise.

data.title: Pleasant stay in convenient area
data.text:
This quaint bed-and-breakfast is in an excellent location for anyone visiting Harvard (or even MIT). Dave, the owner, is super-friendly, and will give you all sorts of tips on what's going on in the city. Dave also shared some of the local history which was extremely informative.

This is not really and bed-and-breakfast, although Dave DOES serve a continental breakfast to your room. What I really liked about it is that I could come and go as I pleased, and had a private entrance to my giant room. The bathroom and adjoining areas were very clean, and the space was perfect for me. I will definitely be back!

data.title: Parkside is the one…
data.text: My wife Nancy and I stayed at Parkside the first week in June. We arrived a bit late do to plane travel delays but were greeted warmly by David who took his time to show us our room and educate us on a few places to see and things to do. The room was great and our morning breakfast was wonderful; which helped to get us going for our 5 days of exploring Boston. We would stay at Parkside again and I'm sure your visit will be as enjoyable as ours.

data.title: Fantastic Accommodation With Easy Access To Harvard Square
data.text: From the moment I arrived David the host created an amazing first impression that carried on until we said our Goodbyes some 4 days later. The room was really well appointed, quiet and gave me a chance to unwind after a day of education. Really conveniently located with a nice 10 minute stroll to Harvard Square and transport options to Boston.

data.title: Quaint and convenient B&B close to Harvard Yard.
data.text: Spent three nights during my grad school reunion in the Scholar room. Very friendly and helpful owner, clean and charming room (wonderful selection of old books to peruse), and excellent location -- walk anywhere in Harvard or Central Square in 10-15 minutes. Quite private and quiet. Feels like staying in someone's very nice spare room. Only cons were (1) very expensive for what you get (though this is a criticism I'd levy at all accommodations in Cambridge) and (2) no daily housekeeping.

data.title: beautifully appointed, quiet, comfortable retreat near everything
data.text: This B and B is conveniently located to Harvard Square and the T, and yet on a quiet residential street.  The rooms are beautifully decorated and soothing.  Breakfast arrives on a tray in the morning--the offerings are limited but you can have as much as you want.  David was extremely personable and accommodating.

data.title: Mr & Mrs L Lob and Dr & Mrs C Gluckman
data.text:
Position of B&B convenient. Room comfortable.
Service totally non existent. After our first night, we came back to find the beds not made, bathrooms not cleaned,trash cans not emptied out. In fact there were no cleaners at all. However, If you stay 6 days or more then on 6th day your room will be 'freshened up'. Have you ever??? I have never heard of a B & B with no service.
Even more disturbing was our bathroom cabinet with used toiletries from previous guests- half bottles of shampoo, creams, lotions and even half a box of tampons. David was proud of this. Most unprofessional and unhygienic.
During our 2 night stay we tried to contact David but to no avail.
After our initial meeting when we arrived, we never saw anyone connected to this B&B again.

data.title: Charming, comfortable and convenient
data.text: We had such a great experience at the Parkside. David was an amazing host - I spoke with him by phone and email several times in advance of our visit and he could not have been more helpful. He went out of his way to make our stay easier, and was an incredibly gracious host. We stayed in the Cambridge room, which was great!  When you walk in, there is a lovely breakfast nook (surrounded by bookshelves), where we had our breakfast each morning. it was delivered via dumbwaiter, which was between the nook and the bedroom, and across from the bathroom. Everything was spotlessly clean, and although the bathroom wasn't huge, it was more than big enough for us. There are not toiletries provided, but there is a cache of supplies other guests have left, and we were close walking distance to stores and pharmacies if we needed anything. Closet and shelf space is very large, and the bed is a nice king (one of the issues about which David was so kind was replacing the feather comforter and pillows due to our allergies). The large windows let in light, a space heater provided extra warmth (which really wasn't needed, even on a cold Jan day), and there was also a desk for us to do a bit of work, and a sofa to sit and read. It felt large, light and airy. We were right next to the Cambridge Public Library, and only a short walk from Harvard Square and the T (on David's recommendation, we took the T to and from the airport and it was amazingly easy and quick - and free when boarded at the airport). Yes, breakfast is light, but that worked out perfectly for us. Each morning as we were getting ready, we had an early meal of english muffins, juice and coffee, and then a later brunch/lunch to get us through til dinner. If we had wanted, there was a fridge in the room and we could have easily brought fruit or snacks. David provides lots of little touches like glasses, corkscrew, sewing kit, iron, blowdryer, lint brush, umbrellas, etc... It is really a perfect location if you're visiting Harvard, but honestly, with the T so close, it is a great location for anywhere you are going in Cambridge/Boston. I would have liked to see it in the summer, but even in winter, it was a really nice place to spend a weekend. Would definitely return!

data.title: Cambridge Retreat from the Madding Crowd
data.text: Charming book-lined rooms (especially books on architecture and gardens), warm welcome, great location near Fogg Museum and Cambridge Public Library (where there is free internet, comfortable places to read, and a nice lawn in front). Near Harvard Square but out of the bustle.

data.title: Fantastic location and thoughtful host
data.text: Our family stayed for three nights in August in the Victorian and Scholar's room. David helped enormously by giving us a parking permit for our car (which we didn't use at all while we were in Cambridge) and with general advice. The rooms were comfortable and had everything we could want in them. I definitely preferred the Victorian room as it is airy and light but out teenage/young adult kids were perfectly happy in the Scholar's room. Breakfast is a little rigid - you have to inform David by a certain time the previous evening if you want breakfast the following day, but that said, when we asked a bit too late, breakfast duly arrived no problem. A bit of variation in the content would be good but this is a minor quibble. The location is fabulous - an easy walk to Harvard and the T.

data.title: A hidden shangri-la on Ellery Street
data.text: I spent three nights in the Scholar room at Parkside on Ellery early in October.  I had read earlier reviews and was looking forward to the experience, but I wasn't prepared for the beauty and thoughtful touches that surrounded me on all fronts.  The house itself is engulfed in a glorious hidden garden (landscaped by David, the owner/host) and my room was a few stone steps down below ground level but I still had windows that opened out into the leafy world outside my door.  My room was small but elegantly appointed, with a wall of built-in bookshelves, a luxurious bed and plenty of closet and cupboard space.  The bathroom was simple, immaculate and equipped with lovely fixtures and linens.  David provided me with a great binder full of neighborhood maps, restaurant ideas, contacts for taxis, laundries, and anything else I might be needing - and - above and beyond all expectations, he even appeared in a moment of crisis, as if by magic, with a tub of wonderful toys for my great grandson who was visiting but having a momentarily difficult time. I placed my order every night for the breakfast I wanted in the morning - choices of coffee, tea, english muffins, jam, muesli and juice; my tray was waiting for me outside my door at the time I had asked for it to be delivered.  So civilized!  And across from the house is a marvelous park, in the middle of which sits the Cambridge Public Library.  It's a short walk to Harvard Square and an extra special jaunt to see the Blaschka Glass Flower exhibit at the Harvard Museum of Natural History.  If you're looking for a most special experience in Cambridge, Parkside on Ellery is the place.  Book early - I noticed in the room's guest book that travelers often come for return stays.  I know I will.

data.title: Pleasant Stay
data.text: Stayed for 2 nights in their "Scholar's Retreat" basement room.  Very comfortable. Nice breakfast.  Walking distance to Harvard and Harvard Square.  The room needed a dehumidifier which was a bit noisy, but which could be turned off.  Host nice and helpful.  Price reasonable for Cambridge, especially in this location.

data.title: Great location--loved it
data.text: We were thrilled to be able to take in much of Cambridge within an easy walking distance. David was a perfect host and gave us some great tips for dining and for how to manage the limited parking. Parking turned out to be a complete non-issue at no cost!

data.title: Home away from home
data.text: My husband and I were moving our daughter into her new apartment nearby. Our room was very comfortable, clean, spacious and very homey. It was a hot weekend, and we happily slept very well in our cool room and comfy bed. David was very gracious and warm. Our breakfasts were so nice. Wake up and open your door to a lovely tray of goodies and good coffee. Conveniently located to all, and so nice to come home to at the end of the day. We would stay here again. Perfect B & B experience.

data.title: Quirky, lovely, convenient B&B...would return
data.text: great location, across from the library; walk everywhere. Beautiful room...traditional but hadeverything you need (could use a larger bed)...desk, loveseat, towels, books, guides, street view, victorian feel (view the photos online)...nothing new, but it all worked.heater, fan, shower, windows, shades-and this is much appreciated....breakfast can get boring...english muffins and cereal delivered at  your specified time...david...add some fruit! Lights could be dimmed or brightened for desk work.

user_location.name: new york city & palm beach gardens Fl

data.title: Loved it.
data.text: Our stay here was perfect. David is very particular about details which made for a really comfortable, super clean room (The Victorian). Some of the reviews mentioned breakfast. We found the breakfast to be personalized and very good and enjoyed eating it in our room while in our pajamas. Perfect location for walking to Harvard and the river. Would definitely stay there again. Thank you David for a nice visit.

data.title: Relaxing and Pleasant
data.text: I stayed 4 nights in the Victorian room and enjoyed it very much. The bed was comfortable, the room beautifully decorated and the bathroom well equipped. WiFi worked fine. The breakfast was perfect for me and my dietary needs were taken in to account. I hope to return!

data.title: Great for a a visit to Harvard
data.text:
We had a great relaxing four night experience at this B&B.  We stayed in the Scholar Room which had its own private entrance in the basement.  Boston was in the midst of a heat wave hence it was great to have a cool room in the basement.  The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. There was a fridge and good wifi access. The B&B is located a mere five minutes walk from Harvard Square and also close to a number of good restaurants. 
The breakfast is advertized as 'continental' and is, therefore, quite limited.  Our only suggestion to David, the owner, would be to provide some flexibility for persons with dietary restrictions (in our case my wife's gluten intolerance), especially given that this was advised in advance of our arrival. Otherwise a great place.

data.title: Inn Full of Thoughtfulness
data.text: Stayed 2 nights in the Scholar room in mid June. Host David was incredibly thougtful from greeting me at a very late arrival time, to assistance with directions etc. Was in the city for a family member's memorial, the peacefulness of the setting, incredible attention to details in the room, as others have mentioned and David's kindnesses helped considerably to get through a difficult journey. Breakfast, as noted by others, was deliverd right outside the door at the appointed time, with attention to previously discussed dietary needs (thank you!). The room has a welcoming feel, was very comfortable on a warm, NE humid day and had an incredible collection of books to peruse! TV, WiFI and a small fridge were available in the room Location was perfect for walking in the Harvard area and accessing public transportation. I hope to return under happier circumstances, to really enjoy all this location has to offer and will definitely stay here again!

data.title: Very professional. Ideally situated for Harvard
data.text: I spent one night in the "scholar's room" before beginning a summer program at Harvard. It was very well-decorated and right in the middle of a nice area in which to dine and shop. It's just a stone's throw from the campus. Reasonable prices and lovely breakfast.
